medical_history.chief_complaint: Nonexudative type 1 macular neovascularization secondary to age-related macular degeneration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient demonstrated signs of age-related macular degeneration (AMD) at age 79 years and underwent comprehensive examination and multimodal imaging over a 9-year follow-up. The left eye showed good visual acuity (20/30) without exudation, while the right eye had 20/50 visual acuity. A small asymptomatic subretinal hemorrhage was detected 2.3 years after presentation, which resolved within 3 months. No macular exudation was noted at the last evaluation 9.3 years after presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, gastric cancer, hypercholesterolemia.
